posts.text: A. Div. 7 Detils Solution12345678910111213141516171819202122232425262728293031323334353637#include <bits/stdc++.h>#include <string>using namespace std; int main() {#ifndef OI freopen("input.txt", "r", stdin); freopen("output.txt", "w", stdout);#endif ios_base::sync_with_stdio(false); cin.tie(nullptr); int t; cin >> t; while (t--) { int a; cin >> a; int tmp = a / 7 * 7; int c = a / 10; int d = tmp / 10; int v = a % 10; if (a % 7 == 0) { cout << a << endl; } else if (c == d) { cout << tmp << endl; } else { for (int i = 1; i <= 10; i++) { int ss = c * 10 + i; if (ss % 7 == 0) { cout << ss << endl; break; } } } } return 0;} B. MinorityDetils Solution12345678910111213141516171819202122232425262728293031#include <bits/stdc++.h>#include <string>using namespace std;void solve(){ string s; cin >> s; int zero = int(count(s.begin(),s.end(),'0')); int one = int(count(s.begin(),s.end(),'1')); int ans = min(zero,one); ans -= zero ==one; cout << ans << '\n';}int main() { #ifndef OI freopen("input.txt", "r", stdin); freopen("output.txt", "w", stdout); #endif ios_base::sync_with_stdio(false); cin.tie(nullptr); int t; cin >> t; while (t--) { solve(); } return 0;} C. Kill the MonsterDetils Solution12345678910111213141516171819202122232425262728293031323334353637383940414243#include <algorithm>#include <bits/stdc++.h>#include <cmath>#include <cstdint>#include <iostream>#include <stdexcept>using namespace std;int64_t ceil_div(int64_t a, int64_t b){ return a / b +((a ^ b) > 0 && a % b != 0);}bool win(int64_t HC, int64_t DC, int64_t HM, int64_t DM){ int64_t our_attacks = ceil_div(HM, DC); int64_t their_attacks = ceil_div(HC, DM); return our_attacks <= their_attacks;}void solve() { int64_t HC, DC, HM, DM, K, W, A; cin >> HC >> DC >> HM >> DM >> K >> W >> A; bool ans = false; for (int64_t w = 0; w <= K; w++) { int64_t a = K - w; ans = ans || win(HC + a * A, DC + w * W, HM, DM); } cout << (ans ? "YES" : "NO") << '\n';}int main() { ios_base::sync_with_stdio(false); cin.tie(nullptr);#ifndef OI freopen("input.txt", "r", stdin); freopen("output.txt", "w", stdout);#endif int n; cin >> n; while (n--) { solve(); } return 0;}

A.Adjacent Squares é¢˜é¢ï¼šThere is a grid with H horizontal rows and W vertical columns. Let (i,j) denote the square at the i-th row from the top and the j-th column from the left.Find the number of squares that share a side with Square(R,C).Here, two squares(a,b) and (c,d) are said to share a side if and only if âˆ£aâˆ’câˆ£+âˆ£bâˆ’dâˆ£=1 (where âˆ£xâˆ£ denotes the absolute value of x). å¤§æ„ï¼šåœ¨(H,W)ä¸­æ‰¾åˆ°ç¬¦åˆ(R,C)âˆ£aâˆ’câˆ£+âˆ£bâˆ’dâˆ£=1æ¡ä»¶çš„ç»„åˆæ•°.é¢˜è§£ç…§ç€é¢˜ç›®çš„æ„æ€æ¨¡æ‹Ÿä¸€ä¸‹å³å¯ 1234567891011121314151617181920212223242526272829#include <bits/stdc++.h>#define rep(i,l,n) for(int i = (int)l; i < (int)n; i++)#define PII std::pair<int, int>#define pb push_back#define fi first#define se second#define FAST std::cin.tie(nullptr)->std::ios_base::sync_with_stdio(false)#define all(x) (x).begin(), (x).end()#define endl '
'#define debug(a) cout << #a << " = " << (a) << '
';#define inf 0x3c3c3c3c // 1010580540, 7f7f7f7f:2139062143#define llinf 9223372036854775807#define muticase() int T;std::cin>>T;while(T--)#define muticases() int std::cin>>T;while(T--)solve();using namespace std;using ll = long long;int main() { FAST; int H, W, R, C, ans = 0; std::cin >> H >> W >> R >> C; for (int i = 1; i <= H; i++) for (int j = 1; j <= W; j++) { if(std::abs(i-R) + std::abs(j-C) == 1) ans++; } std::cout << ans; return 0;} B.Enlarged Checker Boardé¢˜é¢Tiles are aligned in N horizontal rows and N vertical columns. Each tile has a grid with A horizontal rows and B vertical columns. On the whole, the tiles form a grid X with (AÃ—N) horizontal rows and (BÃ—N) vertical columns.For 1â‰¤i,jâ‰¤N, Tile (i,j) denotes the tile at the i-th row from the top and the j-th column from the left. Each square of X is painted as follows. Each tile is either a white tile or a black tile. Every square in a white tile is painted white; every square in a black tile is painted black. Tile(1,1) is a white tile. Two tiles sharing a side have different colors. Here, Tile (a,b) and Tile (c,d) are said to be sharing a side if and only if âˆ£aâˆ’câˆ£+âˆ£bâˆ’dâˆ£=1 (where âˆ£xâˆ£ denotes the absolute value of x). (1,1) is a white tile.Two tiles sharing a side have different colors. Here, Tile (a,b) and Tile (c,d) are said to be sharing a side if and only if âˆ£aâˆ’câˆ£+âˆ£bâˆ’dâˆ£=1 (where âˆ£xâˆ£ denotes the absolute value of x). Print the grid X in the format specified in the Output section. é¢˜è§£å¯ä»¥ç…§ç€æ ·ä¾‹æ‰¾è§„å¾‹æ¨¡æ‹Ÿä¸€ä¸‹ 123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627282930313233#include <bits/stdc++.h>#define rep(i,l,n) for(int i = (int)l; i < (int)n; i++)#define PII std::pair<int, int>#define pb push_back#define FAST std::cin.tie(nullptr)->std::ios_base::sync_with_stdio(false)#define all(x) (x).begin(), (x).end()#define endl '
'#define debug(a) cout << #a << " = " << (a) << '
';#define inf 0x3c3c3c3c // 1010580540, 7f7f7f7f:2139062143#define llinf 9223372036854775807#define muticase() int T;std::cin>>T;while(T--)#define muticases() int std::cin>>T;while(T--)solve();using namespace std;using ll = long long;int main() { int n, a, b; int tag; std::cin >> n >> a >> b; for (int i = 0; i < n*a; i++) { if((i/a)%2==0) tag = 1; else tag = 0; for (int j = 0; j < n*b; j++) { if((j / b) % 2 == tag) std::cout << '#'; else std::cout << '.'; } std::cout << endl; } return 0;} C. Adjacent Swapsé¢˜é¢N balls are lined up in a row from left to right. Initially, the i-th (1â‰¤iâ‰¤N) ball from the left has an integer i written on it. Takahashi has performed Q operations. The i-th (1â‰¤iâ‰¤Q) operation was as follows. Swap the ball with the integer xiâ€‹ written on it with the next ball to the right. If the ball with the integer xiâ€‹ written on it was originally the rightmost ball, swap it with the next ball to the left instead. Let $ai$â€‹ be the integer written on the i-th (1â‰¤iâ‰¤N) ball after the operations. Find $a1,â€¦,aN$. å¤§æ„ï¼šç»™å‡ºä¸€ä¸ªé•¿åº¦ä¸ºqçš„è¯¢é—®åºåˆ—$xi$, $1<=xi<=q$,å¯¹äºæ¯ä¸ª$xi$ï¼Œå¦‚æœ$pos[xi] == n$åˆ™ä¸å·¦ç›¸é‚»çš„ä¸€ä¸ªå…ƒç´ äº¤æ¢ï¼Œå¦‚æœ$pos[xi] != n$åˆ™ä¸å³ç›¸é‚»çš„å…ƒç´ äº¤æ¢é¢˜è§£123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627282930313233343536373839#include <bits/stdc++.h>#define rep(i,l,n) for(int i = (int)l; i < (int)n; i++)#define PII std::pair<int, int>#define fi first#define se second#define pb push_back#define FAST std::cin.tie(nullptr)->std::ios_base::sync_with_stdio(false)#define all(x) (x).begin(), (x).end()#define endl '
'#define debug(a) cout << #a << " = " << (a) << '
';#define inf 0x3c3c3c3c // 1010580540, 7f7f7f7f:2139062143#define llinf 9223372036854775807#define muticase() int T;std::cin>>T;while(T--)#define muticases() int std::cin>>T;while(T--)solve();using namespace std;using ll = long long;int main() { int n; std::cin >> n; std::vector<int> val(n+1), pos(n+1); for (int i = 1; i <= n; i++) val[i] = i, pos[i] = i; int q; std::cin >> q; while(q--) { int x; std::cin >> x; int p0 = pos[x]; int p1 = p0; if(p0 != n) p1++; else p1--; std::swap(val[p0], val[p1]); std::swap(pos[val[p0]], pos[val[p1]]); } for (int i = 1; i <= n; i++) std::cout << val[i] << ' '; return 0;} D.250-like Numberé¢˜é¢Let us regard an integer k as â€œsimilar to 250â€ if the following condition is satisfied: k is represented as k=pÃ—q3 with primes p<q. How many integers less than or equal to N are â€œsimilar to 250â€? æ•°æ®èŒƒå›´æ˜¯1e18 å¤§æ„ï¼šåœ¨ä¸å¤§äºNçš„ç´ æ•°ä¸­æ‰¾åˆ°ç¬¦åˆ$k=p*q^3$çš„ä¸ªæ•°é¢˜è§£ï¼šç´ æ•°ç­›+åˆ—ä¸¾q 123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627282930313233343536373839404142434445464748495051#include <bits/stdc++.h>#define rep(i,l,n) for(int i = (int)l; i < (int)n; i++)#define PII std::pair<int, int>#define pb push_back#define FAST std::cin.tie(nullptr)->std::ios_base::sync_with_stdio(false)#define all(x) (x).begin(), (x).end()#define endl '
'#define debug(a) cout << #a << " = " << (a) << '
';#define inf 0x3c3c3c3c // 1010580540, 7f7f7f7f:2139062143#define llinf 9223372036854775807#define muticase() int T;std::cin>>T;while(T--)#define muticases() int std::cin>>T;while(T--)solve();using namespace std;using ll = long long;const int N = 1000005;std::vector<ll> primes;inline void init() { //ç´ æ•°ç­› std::vector<bool> fl(N, false); for (int i = 2; i < N; i++) { if(fl[i]) continue; primes.push_back(i); for (int j = i*2; j < N; j+=i) fl[j] = true; }}ll f(ll p, ll q) { double est = 1; est = (q * q * q); est *= p; return est;}int main() { init(); ll n; std::cin >> n; ll ans = 0; int q = primes.size() - 1; for (int p = 0; p < primes.size(); p++) { while(p < q && f(primes[p], primes[q]) > n) q--; if(p >= q) break; ans += q - p; } std::cout << ans; return 0;} E.Prefix Equalityé¢˜é¢ï¼šYou are given integer sequences A=(a1â€‹,â€¦,aNâ€‹) and B=(b1â€‹,â€¦,bNâ€‹), each of length N. For i=1,â€¦,Q, answer the query in the following format. If the set of values contained in the first xiâ€‹ terms of A, (a1â€‹,â€¦,axiâ€‹â€‹), and the set of values contained in the first yiâ€‹ terms of B, (b1â€‹,â€¦,byiâ€‹â€‹), are equal, then print Yes; otherwise, print No. å¤§æ„ï¼šç»™å®šä¸¤ä¸ªæ•°ç»„aã€bï¼Œå¯¹äºæ¯ä¸ªè¯¢é—®${x,y}$ï¼Œæ±‚å‡º$Set {-ai(1<=i<=x)}$å’Œ$Set{-bi (1<=i<=y)}$æ˜¯å¦ç›¸åŒï¼Œï¼ˆå¯ä»¥ç”¨c++ STLä¸­çš„setï¼‰æ¥å®ç°ã€‚é¢˜è§£ï¼šå¯ä»¥ä½¿ç”¨å“ˆå¸Œ+setçš„åšæ³•å®ç°ã€‚ 12345678910111213141516171819202122232425262728293031323334353637383940414243444546474849#include <bits/stdc++.h>#define rep(i,l,n) for(int i = (int)l; i < (int)n; i++)#define PII std::pair<int, int>#define pb push_back#define FAST std::cin.tie(nullptr)->std::ios_base::sync_with_stdio(false)#define all(x) (x).begin(), (x).end()#define endl '
'#define debug(a) cout << #a << " = " << (a) << '
';#define inf 0x3c3c3c3c // 1010580540, 7f7f7f7f:2139062143#define llinf 9223372036854775807#define muticase() int T;std::cin>>T;while(T--)#define muticases() int std::cin>>T;while(T--)solve();std::mt19937_64 mrand(std::random_device{}());using namespace std;using ll = long long;using ull = unsigned long long;const int N = 201000;std::map<int, ull> cnt;std::set<int> cnta, cntb;ull ha[N], hb[N];int n, a[N], b[N];int main() { FAST; std::cin >> n; rep(i, 1, n+1) { std::cin >> a[i]; if(!cnt.count(a[i])) cnt[a[i]] = mrand(); ha[i] = ha[i-1]; if(!cnta.count(a[i])) ha[i] += cnt[a[i]]; cnta.insert(a[i]); } rep(i, 1, n+1) { std::cin >> b[i]; if(!cnt.count(b[i])) cnt[b[i]] = mrand(); hb[i] = hb[i-1]; if(!cntb.count(b[i])) hb[i] += cnt[b[i]]; cntb.insert(b[i]); } int q; std::cin >> q; while(q--) { int x, y; std::cin >> x >> y; std::cout << (ha[x] == hb[y] ? "Yes
" : "No
"); } return 0;}
